intro: Pseudostellaria wuyishanensis, commonly known as the Wuyishan starwort, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and delicate foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountainous regions, where it thrives in cool, humid climates. Its botanical features include hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, which are adaptations to its specific ecological niche. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
